name: one car object
code:
class Car:
    def __init__(self, tank_size, gas):
        self.tank_size = tank_size
        self.gas = gas
    def fuel(self, gallons):
        added = min(gallons, self.tank_size - self.gas)
        self.gas = self.gas + added
        return added
    def drive(self, consumption):
        if self.gas < consumption:
            self.gas = 0
            return False
        self.gas = self.gas - consumption
        return True
    def get_fuel(self):
        return self.gas
car = Car(11, 0)
gallons = car.fuel(25)
print(gallons)
car.drive(15)
print(car.get_fuel())

name: two car objects
code:
class Car:
    def __init__(self, tank_size, gas):
        self.tank_size = tank_size
        self.gas = gas
    def fuel(self, gallons):
        added = min(gallons, self.tank_size - self.gas)
        self.gas = self.gas + added
        return added
    def drive(self, consumption):
        if self.gas < consumption:
            self.gas = 0
            return False
        self.gas = self.gas - consumption
        return True
    def get_fuel(self):
        return self.gas
 
    def has_more_fuel(self, another):
        return self.gas > another.gas

car = Car(29, 5)
gallons = car.fuel(25)
print(gallons)
car.drive(15)
print(car.get_fuel())
another_car = Car(29, 5)
another_car.fuel(10)
print(car.has_more_fuel(another_car))

name: two simple functions
code:
def fuel(gallons, gas, tank_size):
    gas = min(gallons + gas, tank_size)
    return gas
def drive(gas, consumption):
        if gas < consumption:
            gas = 0
        else:
            gas = gas - consumption
        return gas
gas = 50-36
gallons = fuel(25, gas, 50)
print(gallons)
gallons = drive(gallons, 20)
print(gallons)

name: Objects 2
code:
class Car:
  def __init__(self, tank_size):
    self.tank_size = tank_size
    self.gas = 0

  def fuel(self, gallons):
    added = min(gallons, self.tank_size - self.gas)
    self.gas = self.gas + added
    return added

  def drive(self, consumption):
    if self.gas < consumption:
      return False
    self.gas = self.gas - consumption
    return True

  def get_fuel(self):
    return self.gas

  def has_more_fuel(self, another):
    return self.gas > another.gas

car = Car(30)
gallons = car.fuel(60)
print(gallons)
car.drive(10)
print(car.get_fuel())

another_car = Car(30)
print(car.has_more_fuel(another_car))

name: fig07_16.c

description: This example is to create table to enrollment information of each student with primary key and unique key definition

(eid CHAR(20) NOT NULL,
sid CHAR(20),
cid CHAR(20),

name: fig07_17.c
Foriegn Key
description: This example is to define a table with foreign key definition and integrity constraint
code:
CREATE TABLE Enrolled
(sid CHAR(20) NOT NULL,
cid CHAR(20) NOT NULL,
grade CHAR(2),
PRIMARY KEY (sid,  cid),
FOREIGN KEY (sid)
REFERENCES Students
ON DELETE CASCADE
ON UPDATE SET DEFAULT);

(sid INTEGER,

rating INTEGER,

((SELECT COUNT(S.sid)

FROM boats B)
< 100));

name: Call By Reference
Derived Relations
description: This is to find the average account balance of those branches where the average account balance is greater than $1200.
code:
SELECT branch_name, avg_balance
FROM
(SELECT branch_name, AVG(balance)
FROM account
GROUP BY branch_name)
AS branch_avg(branch_name, avg_balance))
WHERE avg_balance > 1200;

name: Block Scope
View Creation (2)
description: This example is to create virtual table customers having either loan or account or both under the name of 'all_customer'.
code:
CREATE VIEW all_customer AS
(SELECT branch_name, customer_name
FROM depositor, account
WHERE depositor.account_no = account.account_no)
UNION
(SELECT branch_name, customer_name
FROM borrower, loan
WHERE borrower.loan_no = loan.loan_no);

description: This example is to find the number of reservations for each red boat.

SELECT b.bid, COUNT(*) AS account
FROM boats B, reserves R
WHERE R.bid = B.bid AND b.color = red
GROUP BY B.bid;

name: calculate_Functions.c
Grouping and aggregating (2)
description: This example is to find the age of the youngest sailor with age > 18, for each rating with at least 2 sailors (of any age).
code:
SELECT S.rating, MIN (S.age)
FROM Sailor S
WHERE S.age > 18
GROUP BY S.rating
HAVING 1 <
(SELECT COUNT(*)
FROM Sailors S2
WHERE S.rating = S2.rating);

name: calculate_Main.c
Grouping and aggregating (3)
description: This example is to find those ratings for which the average age is the minimum over all ratings.
code:
SELECT S.rating
FROM Sailor S
WHERE S.age =
(SELECT MIN (AVG(S2.age))
FROM sailors S2);
